title: How AC Milan, churning through managers and racking up transfer duds, fell further than Manchester United
text:
They are owned by remote Americans, play in red, white and black and have spent most of the decade riffling through managers, players and strategies to recapture former glories. Yet, for all the parochial navel-gazing of recent months, it is not Manchester United but AC Milan who have a greater claim to being “the sick man of Europe”.

When Paolo Maldini captained Milan to their seventh European Cup in 2007, they advanced to within two of Real Madrid. There has barely been a twitch on the thread from them in continental competition since and although their proud record as the second most successful club in the long history of the club game’s greatest tournament endures for now, while Milan have...
description: They are owned by remote Americans, play in red, white and black and have spent most of the decade riffling through managers, players and strategies to recapture former glories.
